Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: புரந்தார்கண் நீர்மல்கச் சாகிற்பின் சாக்காடு இரந்துகோள் தக்கது உடைத்து.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: If (heroes) can so die as to fill with tears the eyes of their rulers, such a death deserves to be obtained even by begging.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A hero has fallen in battle. Their king ('புரந்தார்') is kneeling beside them.
Layered_Composition.Midground: The king, a powerful and stoic figure, is shown with tears streaming down his face ('கண் நீர்மல்க'), his grief at the loss of his hero overwhelming his royal composure.
Layered_Composition.Background: This death, which has earned the tears of a great king, is shown to be so glorious that it is a prize to be sought after. This is visualized by other young warriors looking on, not with fear, but with a look of desperate longing, as if they would beg for such a noble end ('இரந்துகோள் தக்கது').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: A death that causes one's leader to weep is a death so glorious that it is worth begging for.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The king's tears are the ultimate measure of the hero's worth. The longing looks of the other warriors show that this death is an achievement, not a tragedy.
Art_Direction.Mood_and_Emotion: Glorious, honorable, tragic yet desirable, the ultimate mark of respect.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A dramatic, poignant light, perhaps a single shaft of light from the heavens illuminating the fallen hero and the grieving king. The king's tears could catch the light like diamonds.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A close-up on the emotional scene between the fallen hero and the crying king, with the longing warriors in the background.

Cultural_Anchors: A death that makes the protector weep ('புரந்தார்கண் நீர்மல்கச் சாகில்')
A death worth begging for ('சாக்காடு இரந்துகோள் தக்கது')
The glory of a heroic death.
